description: Early Homo Erectus, direct ancestor of modern humans, coexisting with Australopithecus and Paranthropus
Migrations of Homo Erectus from Africa to Eurasia
Earliest stone hand axes
Earliest control of fire, by Homo Erectus
Male-male alliances in Homo Erectus social groups
Earliest organic tools: a hand axe made from hippopotamus bone
Replacement of Homo Habilis by Homo Erectus in Africa
Extinction of Paranthropus, our last remaining sibling genus
Homo Antecessor in western Europe
Earliest cannibalism, in Homo antecessor
Extending the day with firelight; improving nutrient uptake with cooked food
Rise of Homo Heidelbergensis in Africa and Europe, possible ancestor of Homo Sapiens and Homo Neanderthalensis
Rise of Neanderthals Homo Neanderthalensis across Europe
Widespread use of fire
Earliest evidence of food storage for later consumption: bone marrow
Earliest representatives of our species, Homo sapiens
Replacement of Homo heidelbergensis by Homo neanderthalensis in Europe
Earliest built constructions: underground edifices made from broken stalagmites by Neanderthals
Prelude to Earth's Last Glacial Period
Burial of dead, by anatomically modern humans in Qafzeh Cave, Israel, and by Neanderthals in Tabun Cave, Israel: mortuary rituals, mourning the dead
Global population of humans passes 50 million
Crop failures across the northern hemisphere caused by volcanic eruptions in Iceland
Global population of humans passes 500 million
Mass production of spun textiles, mechanized by water power; coal-fired and steam-powered production of iron and steel
First scheduled trans-Atlantic steamer: coal-fired Great Western
Industrial processing of flour and sugar; fattening of cattle in feedlots
First commercially viable power stations, coal-fired
First car with gasoline-powered internal combustion engine
First powered, controlled flight by a heavier-than-air aircraft
Introduction of factory assembly lines for mass production of cars
World War I
Spanish flu pandemic
Invention of leaded petrol
World War II
Atomic bombs dropped by the US on Hiroshima and Nagasaki
First supersonic flight, in a rocket-powered aircraft
Invention of the transistor
Beginning of a rapid acceleration in global crop yields
First nuclear power plant
Discovery of a human-induced hole in the stratospheric ozone layer
Global population of humans passes 5 billion
Chernobyl disaster
Invention of the World Wide Web information system
The Rio Earth Summit, Brazil, hosts the largest gathering of world leaders as of 1992
Launch of online marketplace Amazon.com
Ongoing and accelerating rise in global mean sea level exceeds 3 mm/year by 2000
A heatwave across Europe causes 70,000 additional deaths in summer 2003
Humanity is overstepping three planetary boundaries to a safe operating space: climate change, biodiversity loss, nitrogen cycle
Atmospheric concentrations of CO₂ exceed 400 ppm for the first time in at least 3 million years, an accelerating rise
Hottest ground surface temperature on Earth: 80.8°C
First case of COVID-19
Human-made materials surpass Earth's total living biomass

The world ocean reaches its hottest ever recorded in 2021, for the third year and seventh decade in a row, contributing to coral bleaching and sea-level rise; fuelling marine heatwaves, cyclones and hurricanes
Record-breaking heatwaves, heralding extreme droughts in China and western Europe, and flooding in Pakistan that displaces 33 million people
